description: A showground, fairground, carnival, concerts, horse show, farmyard, garden show, food hall, restaurants, and a fabulous Mardi Gras parade are all rolled into one for the Canadian National Exhibition, held in Toronto each year. For 18 amazing days leading up to and including Labor Day on the first Monday in September, about 1.5 million visitors flock to Canada’s largest fair, The Ex, in Exhibition Place by the shores of Lake Ontario. It's a far cry from its beginnings in 1879 to promote farming, industry, and arts as today the fair acts as a showcase for the nation. It is a fabulous annual tradition to head to the city for amazing, old-fashioned fun for all the family and, for many, it is seen as a celebration of the end of summer.

reviews.title: Been to CNE when I was a child, this was the worst
text: If you grew up at the CNE, you will also admit this was the worst year ever.  Prices for games even kids games are ridiculous.  Cost more to play games compared to prizes offered.  $10 minimum to play any game or $20 for a better prize.  You are basically paying for the prize, but half the toys are Dollarama level.  Games once upon a time were $2, $3, $5, or $10 maximum.  Air show was not as spectacular as prior years.  minimal tricks, more fly by. No extraordinary food at the food building to really talk about.  If prices stay the same or go up next year, I don't recommend the CNE and would probably recommend spending your money at Wonderland or Centerville depending on your age.

reviews.title: Loved the Rhinestone Rodeo and the Fire Guy show at the CNE
text: We went to the CNE for the first time ever! We took our 7 year old granddaughter and totally enjoyed the experience. She really liked the games and was thrilled to win a cute stuffie. I liked the food pavilion, it had something for everyone.

Our favourite thing was  the Rhinestone Rodeo Show, it was very engaging and had everyone singing,  clapping and tapping their feet!  We were so charmed by their afternoon performance that we stayed for their night time show with The Fire Guy. What a spectacular show!
Thanks for the memories CNE

reviews.title: Just. Don’t.
text: The sheer amount of copium required for this thing TO EVEN EXIST is staggering. I went in, bought a 20 dollar hot dog, walked around and GTFO as fast as humanly possible. These events make me sad to live in Canada

reviews.title: If you are into fairs, it is a must.
text: I went to TheEx for the experience but I just can’t say it as fun as I thought. My wife and I took my granddaughter and went straight to the kid’s amusement park. It is really far from the parking area so be prepared to walk or wait for the little tram that moves people around. Kid’s world is ok I guess but nothing to write home about. Then we went to the farm which was the highlight for me. My granddaughter also enjoyed all the activities. If you have small children it is a must go building. If you don’t have a lot of money, stay at the farm as much as you can, everything there is free. We went for food and there were plenty of options. Not too expensive but more than what you pay normally for fast food. The Art’s and crafts was our next destination. Some intriguing stands and interesting things all around but it was the same you would find at a flea market. We stopped to watch a couple of events and then took the tram back to the parking building.
Some tips: use public transit, arrive early before rush hour, buy your tickets online. If you have a presto card you will get a good discount. Bring your own food and bring water bottles.

reviews.title: AWESOME PLACE!
text: Deove up from New York City to attend. Love the vibe of this exhibition. This place has something for everyone! Love the youthful staff that this place hires. This place is very organized. Everyone who works here are engaging. Theres a section in the back for smaller children. They have multiple of what seem like small airline hangers filled with different things going on. One has variety of food stations. Another has stations selling things like crafty jeeries etc. another has different flower gardens. Its just an amazing vibe! I will be attending next yr again. OH! AND IF YOU ATTEND AFTER 5pm Monday thru Thursday you can buy admission tickets for $13. Reg price is like $26

reviews.title: WAY too expensive, but always a good time
text: I’ve been coming to the CNE my whole life. The best times were when Ontario Place was still open. We still have a good time when we go but I feel like Wonderland, it has lost a lot of the magic. Biggest negative is the cost of everything including $50 just to park your car. Tons of amazing food options as always even though the majority of them are super expensive, there is no shortage of amazing food here. In the food building I tried one of the Gangnam Style Dogs and it was so delicious, gimmicks aside. My fiancé got a lobster Mac and cheese from Eat My Bowls and it was also very tasty. Tons of hits and also some misses here. You’ll have fun, but you’ll definitely leave with lighter pockets. SO EXPENSIVE.

reviews.title: Expensive and Overrated
text: I am writing this review because I am so frustrated with how expensive The Ex has become, for a family of 4 just to buy tickets and rides for 2 kids will be $200 not including food and games, I mean how are people not boycotting this and how are people paying this.  I am angry that Toronto is so overpriced in everything, you need to change your prices so families can afford to go.

reviews.title: Same Experience every Year
text: This is the first time after Covid that we returned to the CNE. It is our 7th time to be here on opening day.
Time Flies, the CNE’s new Acrobatic and Skating Show returned after a long hiatus.
Nothing has changed basically you see the same things every year. We usually come here for the food hall offerings.
What's new? This year there is a Selfie hallway where you can take your selfies with replicas of the CNE famous attractions.

reviews.title: Very Disappointing
text: Been to the CNE twice before although it was some years ago.
The highlight was the air show the rest was food trucks and childrens rides.
On previous visit there was a local culture ie the Canadian indians dancing and local  info about thier culture.
Plus there was many shows of Canadian dancing there was none of this.
20dollars to get in as a senior, wont be voing again.

reviews.title: A good day out
text: We'd never heard of the CNE though having been told about it by the locals decided to pay it a visit. It was a bit of trek from our hotel, though easy enough to get to via public transport (in our case we used the trams). As we went on a Monday our son got in for a reduced U13 rate, so it was relatively inexpensive. In terms of things to do it was pretty good, with a mixture of fairground rides, food stalls, trade exhibitions, a photography exhibition, bars, music stages and when we visited, the Canadian armed forces were there along with vehicles and equipment that kids and others could look at and handle. There was also a pricey Pink Floyd exhibition, which given the cost and our lack of interest we didn't bother with. All in all an interesting day out and there was plenty to keep us occupied for the entire day.

reviews.title: Great Venue!
text: We have gone to this setting for many things including the CNE for rides, for Home Shows and for BMO Stadium! It’s a well set up venue, lots of indoor and underground parking with lots of food options during events. Luv the princess gates!

reviews.title: Exciting time and experience.
text: So much to do and see....would recremend anyone who hasn't gone to the CNE to go. I plan on going back each year.

reviews.title: Taking family To CNE
text: Took my family to CNE as they hadn't been before. We had a great time, there was lots to do and see. We went on the second day it was open so it wasn't too busy. The food court was huge and had a variety of food. Easy to get to via public transit.

reviews.title: Fun Day!
text: Went back after almost 30 years.  Bought discounted tickets from the Chelsea Hotel.  All day ride pass was $37.00, which is pretty good.

Lots of rides and games.  Some things are a little pricey.  The air show was the next day, so we saw lots of planes practicing.  The food building is really crowded and hot, but there's lots a different food.  Found some amazing fried chicken.  Also saw the Superdogs show, which was very entertaining.
We were there around 11:00 when the rides open, so the line ups weren't too bad.  Gets really busy after 5:00.  Took the TTC, so didn't have to worry about parking.

reviews.title: Not what it used to be....
text: The Ex used to be so fun. They have reduced the grounds to such a small area, its way overcrowded with not much to see. The buildings like the Colosseum  is like going to a flea market with cheap junk and people crammed beside you. There are not enough benches to sit so its even worse. The free train is okay but it only goes around the back of the buildings so its not like you get to see anything while on the train. Food building - runs out of food, expensive, with no place to sit, and the washroom lineups everywhere are loooong so you better plan the washroom a half hour in advance. I remember when it was a great place to go, sadly I will not be going back.

reviews.title: Had a good time
text: I was here back in the early 80's (had a great time, seeing exhibits, playing games), and came back in the mid 90's (more shopping than anything else).  The biggest problem from the previous visits - parking.  This year, took the subway and street car, got there from Queens station with 35 minutes.  Nice ride, highly recommended. The subway takes you to Union Street and there is a street car that takes you to the CNE.  Buy round trip tickets, it's impossible to buy the tickets on the way back.  There was no line to purchase tickets to enter.  We went in and went directly to the Food Pavilion, lots of choices, CASH only for a lot of the vendors.  Grab the first seats available, they are very limited.  After lunch we visited the Art and Craft, midway and the shopping Pavilion.  We also visited the Lantern display, the interactive stuff was kind of lame but fun for the kids.  Lots to see, do and eat.  Although, have to admit, not as good as it was thirty years ago, but still will come back.

reviews.title: Busy but fun
text: We arrived shortly after it opened. It was very busy but after we got inside it was easy to move around. We were there with our Grandchildren so we stayed mostly in the kids area and watched the shows. The super dog show was excellent.  There is one main food services building with many food vendors. You could get almost any kind of food you desired. There were long lineups for the kids rides but the lines moved well.

reviews.title: CNE Air Show
text: Just awesome. We came, saw and stayed on till it ended. No words to describe it.

Thrilling, near collision (!) but at what speed....!! Planes at 1.8 Mach means, you hear that thunder in your spine. The plane leaves ... say a spot.... and the roar follows. If it does not thrill you I do not know what will you.
I envied the pilots in there. It must have been a great adrenaline rush I bet.

Finally the Food...... It is die for. What did I have that topped everything? Well the large sized onion, dipped in batter, and deep fried. Dressed it up with condiments and cheese. Ummm Ummmm. It is finger licking good. All in all, it is a great fun place for the family and the "Ex" ended , signifying the end of summer for 2019.

reviews.title: Great attraction for everyone
text: Loved the CNE! Yes it is crowded, parking is expensive, lines are long unless you pay $15 extra but it is a nice place to be before the school starts. Two things I didn't like: when riding with kids it can get expensive, hope they had a kids companion bracelet, and second the home show which could be more attractive. Two things I loved: food, food and the superdogs from President's Choice.

reviews.title: It was pretty ... at the CNE
text: We went to the Canadian National Exhibition once again this summer, but this time with our 10-year-old grandson. Of course he loved the midway, but what impressed us the most was the Silk Road Exhibit inside the Enercare Center where they usually have ice-skating exhibitions.

It was a very beautiful presentation by the Chinese government that covered a lot of  Eastern and Western  fairytales and fables such as Atlas with the weight of the world on his shoulders and Jack climbing the Beanstalk
all done in beautiful silk three-dimensional  oversized  representations.  It was the definition of “pretty“!

reviews.title: people packed like sardines in a can
text: I am very concerned about the health and safety of all the people who attended CNE this year. I went to CNE on Aug. 27th.  It's super crowded/packed! I don't know if they have some sort of regulation on the capacity of this event. But seriously, it's scary to see so many people gathered and packed like sardines in a can, even it's post-pandemic now.

reviews.title: sweet memories
text: I have not visited the CNE in the past ten years - BUT I am reasonably certain it is still worth the visit.  You never know what you will learn by visiting.  There is always so much to do.  the rides are excellent, the Midway is jammed with people.   Bumper cars are always fun.   the Food building - not to be missed.   -

reviews.title: Inflation killer
text: 2022 here. Super-dogs was amazing but missing another half an hour as for the admission pricing was like was that inflation or inflated pricing? Products were only for the rich in mind, with over priced items after the entrance fee. I don't know if I'm going next year. There was no exciting changes as for computer video games. The children love them I guess, while I could do that at home with my friends too!

reviews.title: Wow what a huge event
text: First time here and we were impressed. Way too much to cover in one day, but we tried our best. The farm area was fantastic for little ones. Our little one had such a good time in that building. The kids area was also a hit with her. The midway, both kids and adult was huge. The food options were also huge...so hard to choose what to eat. The super dogs show was a great hit also. Definitely something we hope to do again.

reviews.title: Prices high and dope smokers
text: Parking $40. Unlimited rides $55. or 22 tickets for $22. Large Corn dog $12. Mini donuts $7.50 doz. Coke machine $5.  Lots of dopers smoking up out in public with zero enforcement.  Not impressed with taking my grandchildren. Things need to be cleaned up before I go back.  I bought 6 tickets and 5 ride passes and meals and drinks.  Approx $400 day.

reviews.title: Money grabbing food/drink vendors!! As well as insane midway game prices! Just Disgusting
text: WoW CNE 2022 let me tell you this, you better have deep pockets!!!!!! The price gouging is unreal not as bad as Woodstock 99 on the third day but  wow!! The original price of  ride all day pass at almost 70$ is ridiculous of and don't forget if spend even more money you can skip the line and have priority and make every other shmuck wait even longer!!!! Oh did you wanna throw some darts at balloons well get ready to spend 10 dollars to throw 3 darts. I understand inflation but what increased the balloon prices by 1000% or the air inside the balloons!!! Just absolutely crazy prices.

reviews.title: Return of the CNE
text: On Sunday, September 1, 2019, I went to the Canadian National Exhibition.  I bought my lunch at the Food Building - a sub sandwich from the Steak and Cheese Factory, some fries from the same vendor, and a coffee from Hula Girl - and ate them outside.  It was the weekend of the Canadian International  Air Show, so I watched the planes fly overhead while eating lunch.
After I finished my lunch, headed down to the "bleachers" / Bandshell Park to watch the remainder of the airshow, which ended with the Snowbirds.

After the airshow was over, I walked through the midway past the rides and games, to Oktoberfest, a Bavarian-themed food truck and craft beer festival on Princes' Boulevard.  I'd buy myself a 'glass' of Wasaga Beach beer, and spin the wheel to win a prize at one of the games  and would win a Wasaga Beach tote bag.  I stuck around and took in the Bavarian-themed music and entertainment on stage sung in German as well as English.

reviews.title: The (Air) Show Must Go On!
text: Although the Canadian National Exhibition (CNE) was cancelled again due to the ongoing pandemic - going ahead with the fair would have likely  created a potential super-spreader event considering the sheer numbers who attend it - the Canadian International Air Show returned for the Labour Day weekend.  It was safe enough to proceed with the air show; people attending it in person could stand two feet apart; the cancellation of the CNE freed up space.   The (air) show must go on!

The air show drew modest sized crowds of aviation aficionados to the Toronto waterfront, to both the Exhibition grounds and Ontario Place.  The weather was ideal, a mixture of sun and cloud, and not too hot and humid.  There were a couple of festivals at Ontario Place, one of them actually provided commentary of the aircraft flying overhead.  At the south end of Ontario Place, the Vista Eatery had an air-show themed menu.  Attendees at the Toronto Undergraduate Jazz Fest listened to the music on stage and watched the air show at about the same time.
The air show featured various aircraft - F35, the CF18, the Gryphon helicopter and a few other acts, and ended with the Showbirds.

reviews.title: Glasses went into my eyes and they ignored it
text: Will not support anything related to CNE or theEx ever again. I used to be a big fan of them, ever since I know how they treated their customers from my own experience, no thank you. This summer, I had broken glasses from one of their employees changing the light tubes and splattered everywhere and went into my eyes. I contacted them, a month later they finally got back to me and promised they would reach out to me in a week. A week later, nothing of coz. I kept calling them, finally they picked up my call with an annoying tone and said they would send me something in mail. I received and it’s 4 passes of all day rides in 2020! That’s how jokes they treat their customers! No sorry, no nothing! Just 4 passes and want me to go away! So if you want to risk yourself and get hurt, then go.  See attached pics as proof.

reviews.title: CNE AirShow 2019
text: Not disappointing. Really enjoyed the show, had a great view  Weather interfered with some of the show.

reviews.title: Fun experience!
text: We had a blast! We were visiting from NY and went on Food Products Day. Unfortunately we missed that part.. it was only until 2 pm. We stayed away in the daytime due to rain and arrived around 4. The website DID NOT mention anywhere that it was only until 2 pm and I tried to email and never got a response when I wanted to ask before traveling. So we missed the wheels and prizes. (We like that). The rides were fun but some lines got very long. The skyway line was UNBELIEVABLE toward the end of the night. I know people take it to get more toward the front of the midway but the line was halfway of the walk there so to us, it was worthless to stand around to wait when you are halfway there. Food truck selection was awesome, food product building was awesome. I wish the "arts and crafts and hobbies" was labeled a flea market b/c that is what it was. Vendors selling their crafts. I thought it would be a fun area for kids... arts n crafts. We missed some of the shows and inside exhibits but the kids had fun. Some games are priced well some are stupid expensive.

reviews.title: Huge
text: A vast exhibition, we spent the whole day there looking around all of the buildings and all of the outdoor parts. Tonnes to see and do for all the family. Good outdoor funfairs one for the children and one for more daring riders.
Great fun day out.

reviews.title: Rip of
text: Rip of
Absolute garbage
They charge $40 for parking
$40 for entry
And you have to pay for rides
No mention the overpriced food
Avoid the cost

reviews.title: It was a very fun experience overall.
text: Really enjoyed the ride i got on since it was not too fast for me. I checked the weather and was glad to go on the best weather day. Did get there early and was able to enjoy the experience before the crowds got larger and was glad that i did. Did notice that the cost of even roasted corn was a bit much but did love the mini donuts and pub type foods and drinks, sorry I missed the dog show but hope to catch it next year.

reviews.title: Retro video game area brings back memories
text: Not gone to a cne in a 5 years
Lot of the buidling as close or sold tor other events like the old automoblie building
Got to see the retro video event area and just love the old games I use to play while
growing up and my friends with me also had fun.  Wish they had more of it and other
events that get people remember their young days.
All in all this cne was ok,  and if they have the retro video area again I will be back with my friends

reviews.title: Lots of fun for the whole family
text: First time going to the Exhibition in 3 years since the pandemic. Parking was $40 and adult admission was $25 adults and $20 for seniors. They have lots of rides, carnival games for prizes. There’s a casino and casino patio. Also the traditional air show. We did the Superdogs Pawvengers show. There are so many shows and events going on everyday. Lots of outdoor food trucks and a food building with lots of choices. There is so much to do here that you can spend the whole day. This is an event that becomes a family tradition every year and the CNE is a Canadian tradition in Toronto and it’s been around 137 years.

reviews.title: The CNE is seriously overcrowded, especially on the weekend,  and the prices are totally outrageous!!
text: Don’t go, especially on a weekend like we did last weekend, because the crowding is totally crazy and the price of everything is totally outrageous!! You’ll line up for at least an hour for the same food you could have bought at home for much cheaper. Be prepared for $4 water and $8 for a cob of corn, and that’s the cheap stuff. The Food building is totally overcrowded with long line ups. Forget about finding a place to sit. anywhere. We went specifically to see Jersey Nights which was on at the midway stage but we didn’t even get to see the whole show because they told us to leave because we weren’t buying their overpriced drinks. This isn’t mentioned on the CNE list of events online. My husband has a serious spinal cord injury and can’t stand long. From what we could see you won’t even get near the rides. I’d advise that you save  your money and go elsewhere. We wish we had.

reviews.title: Pure Money Grab…
text: Expensive money grab.
While I understand we’re dealing with inflation, I just get a sickening feeling when paying for everything.
Might as well take the kids to Canada’s Wonderland as the prices seem in alignment.

reviews.title: Take a chance if it's on when you are there
text: The Ex only runs for a few weeks of the year. We visited on a Monday in August 2022 on a day that rained a bit so it was potentially a bit quieter than usual.
The Ex is a mix of fun fair, agricultural fair, market and street food fair all in one. It had a mix of stuff for adults and children alike and we managed to  strike a good balance.

I imagine on a really sunny weekend day it can be really busy. On a Monday we managed to get an online free ticket in advance for our 5 year old, adults were $25 each. Given the food, fairground rides and the like it could turn into an expensive day but this isn't something we would be visiting every day.

We had a funnel cake, saw the animals, our son played some fairground games and rode on some rides, pottered around the market stalls and filled ourselves up on some really tasty poutine. If I was back in Toronto when this was on, I'd go again.

reviews.title: rip off
text: A total rip off.
$7.00 for a pretzel and $11.00 for a bottle of Coors beer.
There is absolutely no value to it!
We will never go back.
